intro: Ctenodon standleyi, commonly known as the African orchid orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its compact, upright growth habit and produces showy, fragrant flowers in various colors, including white, pink, and purple. The plant typically has narrow, linear leaves and thrives in bright, indirect light with high humidity. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Ctenodon standleyi is also noted for its ability to bloom multiple times throughout the year under proper conditions.
